snippet: America’s view of its wars has been blind to one specific aspect of destruction: the human toll of those who live in war zones.
abstract: Op-Ed article by John Tirman, author and the executive director of the Center for International Studies at MIT, argues that America's view of its wars in Afghanistan, Iraq and Libya has been blind to the human toll of those who live in war zones; asserts that ignoring the extent of civilian casualties and the damage they cause is a moral failing as well as a strategic blunder.
lead_paragraph: America’s view of its wars has been blind to one specific aspect of destruction: the human toll of those who live in war zones.
